title: International Break: Here's all the top players that have been injured so far
text:
Sports News | 11 October 2015 19:36 CET International Break: Here's all the top players that have been injured so far By Wires 
As if the international break wasn’t bad enough for depriving us of League action in exchange for drab one-sided affairs, it’s also featured several world class players picking up significant injuries. 
The biggest losers are undoubtedly Man City who have lost star striker Sergio Aguero and playmaking wizard David Silva. 
Pellegrini’s men aren’t the only league-leaders to lose key men as PSG pair David Luiz and Kevin Trapp picked up injuries while on duty with Brazil and Germany respectively. 
While Luiz may be back in time for PSG’s mouthwatering Champions League clash with Real Madrid on 21 October, Rihanna’s favourite goalkeeper isn’t expected to return to action until at least mid-November. 
Bayern Munich will be without Mario Gotze for up to 12 weeks after the World Cup winner injured his groin in Germany’s shock loss to Republic of Ireland. 
However the imminent returns of Franck Ribery and Arjen Robben will probably ease Pep Guardiola’s concerns. 
Wondering what Mario will get up to during his recovery? 
Juventus give City a run for their money in terms of injury problems. The Old Lady will have to do without Alvaro Morata and Paul Pogba when they return to Turin. 
Initial reports suggested Morata may have fractured his leg but recent news has been more encouraging for Juve fans with estimates of around three weeks being reported in terms of recovery time. 
Karim Benzema scored twice for France against Armenia but was forced to leave the pitch minutes before the full-time whistle with a hamstring injury. 
Funnily enough it may have been caused by Antoine Griezmann jumping on Benzema’s back during celebrations. That’s Athletico’s Griezmann on Real’s Benzema. Suspicious… 
England’s record goalscorer and Dream Team darling Wayne Rooney is set to miss out on England’s trip to Lithuania on Monday. However he should be ready to play at least some part against his boyhood club Everton on 17 October. 
Finally we come to Chelsea, it’s only fitting we leave them to last. 
Both Branislav Ivanovic and Nemanja Matic were forced off in Serbia’s hostile match with Albania although Chelsea fans were considerable less annoyed about the former’s injury. 
With another round of games still to play we advise international managers take the proper precautions to prevent further losses.
